name: Hanging Coffins of Sagada
description: Ancient coffins suspended on cliffs by the Igorot people, believed to bring the deceased closer to ancestral spirits.

name: The Queen Mary
description: A retired ocean liner turned hotel, renowned for reported paranormal activities and ghost sightings.

name: Christ of the Abyss
description: A submerged bronze statue of Jesus Christ, a popular site for divers and associated with maritime legends.

name: Clonony Castle
description: A 16th-century Tudor castle with a history of hauntings and mysterious occurrences.

name: Willard Asylum
description: An abandoned psychiatric hospital with a dark history and reports of paranormal activity.

name: Nevada County Hospital
description: Also known as the Nevada City Insane Asylum, this historic hospital has a reputation for eerie occurrences.

name: Rolling Hills Asylum
description: A former poorhouse and infirmary, now known for ghost tours and paranormal investigations.

name: Hồ Thuỷ Tiên
description: An abandoned water park featuring eerie dragon sculptures and overgrown attractions.

name: Kent Masonic Temple
description: A historic Masonic temple with rumors of secret rituals and ghostly apparitions.

name: The Skull Chapel
description: A chapel adorned with thousands of human skulls and bones, serving as a memento mori.

name: Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum
description: A historic psychiatric hospital known for its massive structure and reports of hauntings.

name: Aokigahara Forest
description: Also known as the 'Sea of Trees,' this forest is infamous for its association with suicides and eerie silence.

name: Chernobyl Exclusion Zone
description: The site of the 1986 nuclear disaster, now a ghost town with decaying buildings and a haunting atmosphere.

name: Island of the Dolls
description: An island adorned with decaying dolls, believed to be haunted by the spirit of a drowned girl.

name: Catacombs of Paris
description: An underground ossuary holding the remains of over six million people, arranged in artistic displays.

name: The Whaley House
description: A historic house museum known for paranormal reports and tragic past events involving the Whaley family.

name: The Bates Mansion
description: Famous for its appearance in Hitchcock's 'Psycho,' the mansion still sits on the Universal backlot.

name: Alcatraz Island
description: The infamous prison island is said to be haunted by former inmates and guards alike.

name: Devils Tower
description: A remote tower-like formation with satanic folklore tied to eerie disappearances and rituals.

name: Winchester Mystery House
description: A sprawling mansion known for its architectural oddities and paranormal reputation tied to Sarah Winchester.
